Message 1026 of 4024
He charges 60 per mount.
Sent:02/03/2024 at 07:18 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/03/2024 at 07:22 PM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1027 of 4024
Ok, thanks.
I am sorry your email went poof. It sucks but you did a great job here. I think we start with what you are sending. I can only digest so much at a time.
Also worried about sending a bunch of stuff that just needs to go back in 8 months. The last conversation we had was me taking over the Kirkland
mortgage.
That said, if it is in your way, of course I want to get it out of your eyesight. But we’re talking about deep into the garage at this point I think. Do you
agree?
Nothing works for the Sonos unless I have the
closet piece.
No worries at all about the pillows. That can be whenever.
What did you think about linen and towels? You suggested we refresh.
I probably need to share other stuff for taxes like my unemployment info.
Hope you are keeping the good extender. I will help when you are ready.
They can only move the heater head. No propane. So it needs to be removed.
Are the socks good or are they the ones we said we would give to Max.
The other clothes I’d like to see before we move them. Still ten bags here.
I would take my backpacks I think. But I owe you luggage back.
Really appreciate the planning. We will get there!
Sent:02/03/2024 at 07:38 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/03/2024 at 08:14 PM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys

Message 1028 of 4024
BTW- I am fine when we are trying to go back and forth with line items or answering more than a single question, doing it for that part only in email.
This is not designed for that. It’s for short, single subject, tweet length communication. We can keep it super professional and then summarize here.
Plus an email client will never loose your work!
Sent:02/03/2024 at 07:48 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/03/2024 at 08:42 PM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1029 of 4024
In my mind I was thinking I keep house but guess we address at later date.
Yes got Sonos piece out of closet.
Socks were straight from closet draw from nice ones to hiking to everyday and not the give to Max.
The bags that are in my way are mainly clothes in front room. I had emptied out the closet and dresser drawers so likely workout gear, ski clothes and
layers and the other items mentioned below. I’ll put whatever you don’t want sent over in garage so I can rent furniture for front room.
Box of promo video cassettes.,throw or send?
Sent:02/03/2024 at 08:20 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/03/2024 at 08:20 PM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1030 of 4024
So... we definitely discussed. You said that you could make it work. But definitely wanted to move. I offered to see if I could help (when we were on
good terms) but you said no. Then I made it clear i planned to try and keep it in the family for the boys sake. It’s all discussed in email. I have never
heard that you want to change your mind. That’s why I have so much heartburn moving every little thing since I’m coming back.
Feel free to send socks
Thanks for Sonos
What are “promo videos”
Sounds good on clothes. I want you to have your space. I am hopeful we’ll find peace and civility at some point (this is neither healthy or sustainable
long term) and then we can work on garage together and I sort what I keep vs. goodwill.

Can you let me know re porno cassettes and other bagged clothes?
I have two new side lamps that we never installed. Do you want those?
Sent:02/04/2024 at 05:13 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 06:59 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1037 of 4024

Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:00 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 07:32 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1038 of 4024
On July 5th, you took everything I had worked with for three decades, almost my entire adult existence away from me. You did this with no warning
and strong and consistent evidence to the contrary. We were partners, lovers, and soulmates. And out of the blue you said we were not. You decided
to abolish ties and abandon your vows to blow up the Moyer’s, and not only leave a man behind, but take his food, water, and curse his existence. The
man who had tried to love, lead, and provide for our crew his whole life.
I was changing. I heard you. I was making improvements to everything I knew was a problem. You saw that. Celebrated that along side me. Told me
that it was the right path, and now we just needed time together. I would like to know what your next big surprise is now. I live in a foxhole waiting
every day for artillery to arrive. Can you please explain your latest secret change of plans and what you are doing next to destroy the man who called
you his queen?
Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:23 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 07:32 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Attachments:IMG_3107.jpg (6 MB)
Message 1039 of 4024
Do you want any of the lawn chairs?
I was going to add the pitching machine and swing away for you to sell along with peloton etc.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:34 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 07:35 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys

Message 1040 of 4024
This is not appropriate to send.
The house is part of assets we need to divide.
Let’s drop this thread please.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:35 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 07:36 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1041 of 4024
You said you were taking the house. After we agreed that I would take it. How is that inappropriate? We had an agreement. You said you have
unilaterally made a secret change of plans that impacts the task at hand, today. I deserve to know what that is.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:38 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 09:36 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1042 of 4024
I’ll take the lawn chairs that are not junk.
No need for porn, but I’d like to destroy with some discretion and privacy. Let’s leave for now and figure out something as we improve our situation.
For any of thenCraigslist stuff, I’ll sell when I move back home. No change of plans. Sticking to exactly what we have agreed to. Thanks!
Sent:02/04/2024 at 07:47 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 09:36 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1043 of 4024
He sounds awful. I’d like to bring “get well”’gift over at some point today. I know it will cheer him up. Please let me know how we can coordinate
logistics.
I can also bring things back if you can think of stuff. I know we have discussed it but I’m drawing a blank.
- Do you need Pyrex? I have too much.
- I think you have enough TV remotes but I have more
- multi socket plugs, do you need any of those?
As I keep sorting I’ll add to the list...
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:18 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 09:36 AM)
Subject:AD Gift

Message 1044 of 4024
I’m not comfortable with you coming to the house.
The tone in your last few emails is aggressive and is making me feel uncomfortable. The RO is in place for a reason.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:39 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 09:42 AM)
Subject:Re: AD Gift
Message 1045 of 4024
I do not know which lawn chairs are not junk so will leave them for now.
I will take care of the porn and destroy it. I do not want it in the house.
We have mediation to sort the house out.
This tone is very aggressive and makes me feel uncomfortable.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:43 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 09:43 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys
Message 1046 of 4024
Please don’t do that. I’m asking to give my son a get well present. I am not trying to be aggressive in the least. We loose a lot in translation. I’m
sincerely sorry if it came across that way. I will try extra hard!
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:43 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 11:08 AM)
Subject:Re: AD Gift
Message 1047 of 4024
I apologize for the misunderstanding in the written word. It’s unfortunate that is the only way we can communicate because we know historically it’s
absolutely the worst way for us to try and get along.
How can we move forward today in a constructive way so we get the most stuff done and also cooperate? I do not want to have a fight with you. I am
looking for a peaceful and constructive resolution.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:45 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 11:08 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki Keys

Message 1048 of 4024
I understand you felt like my tone was aggressive. I have apologize for that. I don’t think the written word does us any justice. It never has and it never
will. It’s unfortunate that that is all we have.
You did let me know that you had a change of plans to something that was very significant in our lives. I would like to understand that better. If you’
re not ready to talk about that, then I will Acquiesce and we can talk about it at another date.
But I don’t want to have another bad day with you. Let’s please work constructively to resolve our problems. We have a lot of stuff on our plate and
it’s Sunday so we can start planning and making progress.
Please respond to this so I know that you have seen it. It gets very frustrating in this mode of communication when I have to wait around hours for
hours and I really don’t know what we’re trying to do.  Thanks!
Sent:02/04/2024 at 09:48 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 11:08 AM)
Subject:Please Don’t Start Our Day Like This
Message 1049 of 4024
I am not trying to be aggressive.
So we can work better together can we establish some mutual expectations for tasks we are working together on?
You send questions. Know I get alerts and will respond. Then check out. So you are well aware of what you’re doing.
Dr. Brown was very clear on her suggestion about how we can have more peaceful communications. To make OFW work, her suggestion was to talk
to each other like you were speaking to your boss afraid of losing yourjob.
So trying let’s imagine you and Julie were working on a problem together in real time that meant a physical time commitment from you both today.
You send some q’s and step away for a few hours not telling her you checked out.
Again not being aggressive, but what would she think? How am I supposed to respond? I’m guess my feedback is you are complaining about me
being aggressive, then doing the most passive aggressive thing ever.
I am asking to work with you on time sensitive planning that requires a physical commitment today. Can we please be more respectful of each other?
Sent:02/04/2024 at 10:10 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 11:08 AM)

Are you and your new man just sitting around clowning on me now? I share you are disrespecting me and my time and just generally being unkind. I
tell you it's an issue with how you use this platform and ask you to stop.
Not only do you not stop, you double down. You continue the same disrespectful behavior, and then up it a notch by sending me new questions
repeatedly you expect answered. And this while you ignore mine when I ask for an answer.
All of this while you are out running around making parental decisions that I have not been a part of because you assumed full custody of our kids,
after rejecting the parenting plan and now make all parenting decisions unilaterally.
I am eager to work with you, but this seems like a perverse joke, with you two sitting around thinking about how to make me look like a fool next. Just
to see how far you can push my face into the mud so you can laugh at my humiliation.
It's honestly just cruel, Christine.

come back.
But you did not. That is all I was asking for.

Why aren’t you comfortable. We will only walk through quick and I’ll show you the projects I’m trying to accomplish so you can pick tools. And you
can see what accent pieces we have that are unused that I can use so I don’t buy new stuff. I’m not going to push my luck if you are doing me a favor.
Or it will never happen again. Please consider it.

Subject:Re: Move
Message 1078 of 4024
Are we planning to never be civil again?
Do we really want to hate each other till we die?
After all we accomplished together in over 30 years.
It’s just too hard to even comprehend, Christine.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 05:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 05:27 PM)
Subject:Re: Move
Message 1079 of 4024
I’m hoping we can be civil.
I’m still reconciling with what happened and navigating.
There are extreme pendulum swings with mood so I found the best way to navigate is stay in the middle.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 05:29 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 05:29 PM)
Subject:Re: Move
Message 1080 of 4024
For the rest of our lives? Civil?
You don’t hope someday that we can catch each others glance and remember a tender moment, a special date. I know you did not hate me for 30
years, and keep having kids. I know we enjoyed our love making. I also know you saw I was getting better. Changing the man I was to be the man you
asked me to be. I was all in.
So you can have a pov on the bad times. That’s fair. But there is no way you can deny that when you were cold, I kept you warm. When you were
hungry, I fed you. And when you cried, I held you. If after 30 years as soulmates, the best we can do is civil it will be a wasted life.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 05:36 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 07:15 PM)
Subject:Re: Move

Message 1081 of 4024
For below to happen there cannot be the volatility in behavior and pendulum swings.
What you are speaking of below is achievable for individuals who are interacting in a normal manner, consistently.
My interactions with you over the last 7 months have been at many times frightening, scary, volatile. You are asking me to revert back to behavior in
the marriage where I pretend things did not happen, brush it off, act happy, and not hold you accountable. That has stoped. I recognize my feelings
and impact and do not just move on. As I process each scary or volatile interaction in a manner that it deserves, and they continue or escalate, it
compounds and gets worse as there is no recognition that you don’t start back at zero each time. It is still in a deficit that keeps getting worse. This
behavior and reaction from me and family is what you do not recognize, which is holding you firmly accountable each time. It does not reset at zero
like it did in the past.
The past 7 months does not demonstrate that is the path we are on.
Sent:02/04/2024 at 08:37 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/04/2024 at 08:37 PM)
Subject:Re: Move
Message 1082 of 4024
I want to thank you for this. It took time, you put thought into it, and it all makes perfect sense to me. I will not justify my reaction to our situation
but I always have held firm that V Little on June 30th would be proud that I was fighting Christine of July 5th. That I would do anything to save our
marriage and keep our family together, fending off anyone who would destroy it. And that’s what I see happening.
That misses the point entirely. I do think she would appreciate me fighting to learn, heal, and have a better, stronger rebirth that puts us on course for
forever. But what I am missing is the way I’m doing it is the entire reason we are here. The thought is noble, the execution is destructive. It’s like a
Chinese finger trap, the harder I fight and struggle, the worse it gets for us both. She would not like that at all.
If I continue the swings, the volatility, the madness, after you made yourself clear tonight in a very thoughtful way, I deserve to never walk down that
path with you. Alternatively, if I show you I listened, like I had listened this spring, and work on myself for the sake of us, I hope it has a better ending.
I realize I have reverted, I thought about it tonight. But I can get back on the right path again. I will show you.
So thank you for the honest feedback. And while it would have been great to hear in June, I do hear it now and I am acknowledging it. I’ll let my
actions do the talking and hope for the best. Both the June 30th and July 5th, Christine’s would want that.
I truly love you, Christine...
forever yours,
robert
